course.subject: LABU
course.name: Business Case Analyses I
course.description: For students who have this course as a program requirement. This course lays the foundation for students to engage in business case analyses by developing their critical reading and thinking skills, as well as their ability to present case analysis findings and recommendations in spoken and written forms.
course.prerequisites: CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1003 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: jjjjman
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content: two presentations. i did my presentation with the same person. it focuses on teaching you how to catch the attention of your audience. the proposal requires you to make your content simple and easy to read.
reviews.comment_teaching: martha's delivery was very clear. i really appreciate her voice projection. she made the points very clear and i rarely had confusion towards the content of the course. she is patient in answering students' question. she also provided consultation session for students to ask problems based on the problems and difficulties they encountered.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading is fair and depends on individuals' performance. The report is around 40% of the final grade. some students' language proficiency is good given that they got level 5*/5** in English language in HKDSE, but they only get b range. while some students got level 4 in HKDSE, they are able to get A range in this course. so it is good for you to pay attention and ask more to make sure you know what is your tutor's expectation.
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is fair, two presentation and one report writing
one lesson per week and the duration is 2 hours.

reviews.author: noname0.0
reviews.title: OK grade la , non really grade god
reviews.comment_content:
He has provided us some extra notes for the assignments , really useful and impressed by his work.

There are generally two presentation and one written report.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice teacher , he will play some song for us to relax before having lesson. He also gave us many recommendation for the final report.

Be careful when you select his lecture, he is really nice teacher for boys. and girls?
reviews.comment_grading: poor grading , he gave me a sub-grade less comparing with my friend class.
reviews.comment_workload: fare workload, no in class exercise , quite good

reviews.author: ztyxfd2912
reviews.title: Good English won't help you as much as you thought
reviews.comment_content: Basically not very useful for people like me who never thought about being a public speaker.
reviews.comment_teaching: Jessie is nice and friendly, she encourages everyone and makes the class atmosphere warm and sound.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grades for you if you're paying enough attention to the final essay. Me got Competent in the first presentation, Very good in the second and High satisfactory in the essay.
I had lots of stuff to handle in final p and just wrote the essay within 4 to 5 hrs then handed it in without even checking the grammar.
Ended up B-. Very lucky for not being in C range.

IMPORTANT ALERT:
Your command of English and abilities to handle a conversation isn't tested as you're going to recite all the stuffs in your presentations. So preparation beats your command of English in this course, and never have the idea of "My classmates won't try too hard", as long as this is an pure RMBI course, they definitely will.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite shit hole for a 2 credit course, still better than MGMT2130 though.

reviews.author: thomasyeu
reviews.comment_content: Fair content. Language course wonâ€™t learn too much. There will be 2 presentations and 1 business writing. For presentations it takes you some time to revise and practice body gestures. 3 mini case in total, you need to refer to the case and blow water.
reviews.comment_teaching: Jessie is patient and very nice. Make jokes sometimes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Hard to get high grading. But wonâ€™t fail if you pay effort.
Our group spend a plenty of time on presentation and turn out getting a b range grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair workload. Not too much for language course.

reviews.author: Hiutung
reviews.comment_content: The course focuses on the presentation skills by reading business cases. There are two presentations required. The instructor will divide two or three people in a group. After having this course, you are able to learn the ways to be more convincing and confident, catching audiences' attention when presenting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Doreen is a very nice tutor, who always smiles. She follows the schedule and it is easy for students to follow her teaching plan. More importantly, she cares about students, and gives great freedom for students. She is patient to answer students' questions through e-mail or in-person meeting.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair and good. The report is around 40% of the final grade. Even I only got Compliment in two presentations, I did well for the report with the three sub-grades very good, excellent and excellent. The report can help you to gain a much better grade. Peer evaluation is also needed.
reviews.comment_workload: Only one lesson once a week. The course requires two presentations and one report writing. The first presentation does not focus on the content you present, but mainly on your presentation skills, while the second one focuses both content and presentation skills. The report requires reading a short case study and then writing a business report, which is not difficult. To conclude, the workload is not very heavy.

reviews.author: Michelle0412
reviews.title: LABU 2051
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is quite useful. It gives a brief introduction of the language required in business. The tasks given is rather relevant to workplace.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is enthusiastic in teaching and is always encouraging. Her lessons are not boring but participation is highly required.
reviews.comment_grading: Attendance is very important in LABU course. Nora is quite a strict marker hen compared to other instructors  but turns out the grade was not that baad.
reviews.comment_workload: There are a total of two presentations and one essay throughout the whole semester. The tasks were not too difficult but time-consuming.

reviews.author: Peony
reviews.title: good grade
reviews.comment_content: the course is all about business case studies, it will teach you how to analyse the case in different perspectives and give feasible solution.  beside, some presentation skills were also be taught.
reviews.comment_teaching: class atmosphere is good and not too boring but of course it depends on your instructor
reviews.comment_grading: the grade is very good. if you are confident with yourself and speak fluent english, the grade of the presentation would not be bad at all. and the requirement of the essay is just moderate, it's also easy to get good marks for it.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is not too heavy, mainly focus on the two presentations and the individual essay.

reviews.author: needgoodgrade
reviews.title: Danyal good grade!!
reviews.comment_content: Tutorials are mainly about presentation skills and case analysis. To be honest, if you have taken LANG 1002 and LANG 1003, you should have got all the necessary skills for this course. Two presentations (two people in a group, graded separately) and a recommendation report at the end of the semester. I don't think the part about case analysis is discussed deep enough. Frankly speaking, if you are quite confident about your presentation performance, don't expect to learn a lot from this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good instructor. Always starts and ends on time. Lessons are very casual and light-hearted though not particularly interesting. The instructor doesn't even require students to wear business formal for presentations.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite relaxed I'd say, compared to other LABU instructors. I know some instructors are very strict on pronunciations and making no mistakes in presentations but Danyal allows mistakes and sees your presentation performance as a whole.
Presentation I: Excellent
Presentation II: Very Good, Competent, Excellent
Recommendation Report: Unknown
Overall Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: Two consecutive presentations are very tiring. But if you are a good speaker then they should be easy to handle. Very important to have a responsible partner to work together. Recommendation report is easy as you can reference the template given and write in short and simple sentences.

reviews.author: Stetanjung
reviews.comment_content: Typical English language class, although it is related to business issues.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He's very nice.

Every tutorial, when the class is about to start, he always plays some popular new songs. He also tries to make the class interesting. He always wraps every tutorial up by giving summary in the PPT to make sure that we know what we learn at that day. Though sometimes, the class might be a bit boring if you have a lot of passive classmates.
reviews.comment_grading:
He gives a good grade, really.

I can say he is a pretty lenient teacher. As long as he knows you pretty well, you will be fine. You just have to be a bit active in the class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not that much, only 1 essay and 2 presentations (the same topic, one is related to the issue, and one is related to the solutions).

At the beginning, the workload seems to be very light, although as the semester is coming to the end, it can be pretty overwhelming.

If you have awesome groupmates, you will be fine. However, if you have freeriders, you need to work a little harder, especially on the brainstorming part to find the solution.

reviews.author: MM
reviews.title: All you need is good teammates!
reviews.comment_content:
Basically this course include 2 cases: ACCT case and MGMT case.

The acct case is a writing task.

The MGMT is a group work. There are two presentations, one counts for 10% and the final one counts for 40% of the mark. The first one is similar to the second one and the purpose is to prepare you for the second presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nora's class is quite relax and not demanding. Personally I think she focuses on presentation skills much more rather than content. In class, she will teach and help you to conduct a better presentation by focusing on sound control, gesture and movement.
reviews.comment_grading:
Average grading. All my task are above or equal to mean, I finally got B grade.

To be honest, you will need to have good teammates(e.g. non-local, international student) and it can bring you to a better mark in group project.
reviews.comment_workload: Mainly workload are on presentation preparation. You will need more practice (Practice makes perfect!).

reviews.author: Mandy233
reviews.title: practice the presentation
reviews.comment_content: the content mainly focused on the case, some presentation skills, some writing skills. It's good to get some presentation experience as a business school student. However, the class did not go into much details of each skill it teach, and of course no time to practice.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite engaging and sometimes interesting when he talked about his family. He didn't teach many knowledge/skills himself, mostly rely on the videos. He is a good presenter and can deliver instant presentation for us as example, but did not demonstrate details like the position you stand, the way you place your hands...
reviews.comment_grading: The grade should depend a bit on the instructor. As long as he likes your writing and presentation, the grade will be rewarding. The same presentation delivered to different instructors would win you different grade i guess.
reviews.comment_workload: should work hard for all you assignments and actively participate in each class!

reviews.author: CRDZY
reviews.title: Awesome Teacher
reviews.comment_content:
The content is mainly summed up with two case studies. One accounting and one management case study. You'll be required to use your essay writing skills to write an internal memorandum for the first case study and do a short presentation about the second case study.

Also, you need to do quizzes online. Just do it, otherwise you'll lose 5%
reviews.comment_teaching: The content is well  focused and she only teaches the necessary content that will be required to get good grades. She is nurturing and is open to any and all questions that you may have. She is also lenient on your quizzes and generally quite observant. So participate in class!
reviews.comment_grading:
I got an A+ but I heard that it's not that easy from others so take what I say with a pinch of salt.

To me, as long as you follow her advice and constantly improve your drafts and presentation skills, she'll give you the benefit of the doubt and give you a good grade.

She will honestly give you a good grade if you are willing to put in the work. She is really observant and will notice if you are constantly contributing to your group discussions or group presentations.
reviews.comment_workload:
This is LABU, the workload isn't low but it isn't ridiculous either. Keep up to date with your quizzes and be sure to regularly meet with your group for practice on presentations. It'll be okay if you are fluent in English but you may need to carry your team a little bit.

You can't choose your group but as long as they're hard-working you honestly shouldn't have any issues.

Good luck. Seriously, don't miss your quizzes. People lose all of their 5% participation if they miss a single quiz. Also, attend all your classes. You will fail if you miss more than 2 lessons.

reviews.author: kelvinlai
reviews.comment_content: 2 cases in total. one acct and one mgmt. both of them are not tricky and there are many materials online. For example, you can simply type in the name of the case on google and you can find tones of information and maybe some could help for the presentation as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: She is nice and easy to get along with
reviews.comment_grading: For me , it is a good grade class and the grading is pretty straight-forward
reviews.comment_workload: one essay and one presentation are not much but it could take up some time for preparation.

reviews.author: cysummm
reviews.comment_content:
This course mainly include 2 parts: ACCT case memorandum, MGMT case presentation. The background of acct case is based on a Korean case which is pointing out the current problems in your branch and the whole company to the senior. It will be somewhat difficult if your course tutor has really strict restriction on your word choice because your may not allowed to use any negative words.

The MGMT is done in group. There are two presentations in the MGMT case, the mini one (present a) just counts for 10% of the total course mark and the final one (present b) counts for 40% of the mark. Its all about pointing out problems in the resort and give suggestion. Confidence while presenting, proper word choice and body language are the key of this case.

The course also have weekly quiz and take attendance. The quiz is easy but be aware of the no. of attempt in the quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The tutor is new to ust so he follow quite strict to the course outline and read every sentence in the materials to make sure we all know that they are included in the course ==

Other then that he is quite nice and funny. He always share many real life experience to us. He also encourages us not to pay too much focus on gpa only.
reviews.comment_grading: It hard to say because the raw marks given by tutor will be adjusted in the end to become your grades. Normally will be b range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Need to read the materials on canvas and prepare them before class.

The mark for quizzes is all or none so if you forget to finish one of them, you will lose all the mark.

The MGMT case is so freaking long.

reviews.author: Hugh
reviews.comment_content: Business case analysis, two cases, three presentations
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaches in very laid back style. Lots of students play on their phone and its okay. He jokes around a lot. Very nice, gives out good tips.
reviews.comment_grading: Gives good grade. As long as you take his tips to heart, and carry them out
reviews.comment_workload: We have weekly online quizzes, but their not marked. You just have to finish them. Workload isn't that much. We just need to present three times. One presentation for one case, and two presentations for another one and thats that.

reviews.author: IT
reviews.title: All depends on you
reviews.comment_content:
I guess people already typed what we need to do, so I will make it short.
-1 writing assessment
-2 presentations, one is assessed based on your individual performance, the other is a group base
In the lesson, two case studies are analysed, and some presentation skills (e.g. hedging, posture) are taught
reviews.comment_teaching: I think the class is pretty relaxing. She always smiles in the lesson. She likes to ask question, and encourage everyone to participate in the class. Since mine is a 9am lesson, so not all of the students are too energetic. The general atmosphere is normal. One thing I like about her is that she would ask us to present in groups to practice on the week before both presentations, and give very good advice, so we could practice more, and improve after her suggestions. Not all instructors will provide chances for us to practice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair.
I got 5,5,6 in the writing assessment, 6,6 in the first presentation, and 5,5 (group part), 6,6 (individual part) in the second presentation. I did not skip any online quiz, so I will get 5%. You cannot skip too many of the classes too.
I got B+ at last. I have 2 groupmates, one got C, and another unknown.
I could not judge if our instructor is good or not, as one of my groupmates (the unknown grade) freeride us for both presentations, so I worked very hard in order not to hinder my grades for too much. If I have a better groupmate, I think I could get A range. I also think asking more questions both in class and through emails can help her remind of you, so try to ask more questions to raise your impression mark :D
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not too big, if you have good groupmate. As i have mentioned, I don't have a good groupmate, I need to work very hard, basically I drafted the whole layout, think for all points and solutions myself. So it is pretty tiring, but I learned a lot.
Generally, the workload is alright, I am sure everyone finds it difficult to memorize a script of 3-5 minutes at the beginning. But, practice makes perfect, try to finish your scripts/ points as soon as possible so that you have more time to make sure you can speak fluently and practice your gestures.

reviews.author: thettjess
reviews.comment_content:
Accounting case: essay 30%
Management case: presentation x2 50%
reviews.comment_teaching: She gives every single details during class and provides comprehensive analysis.
reviews.comment_grading:
the grading is fair~~ Not particularly bad or good

To be honest, it really depends on your own ability. Some of my group mates got B- as the presentation has an individual mark and a group mark.

I got mostly competent and very good for the essays and presentations. I got a A- eventually.
reviews.comment_workload: There are not a lot of workload at first but the last few weeks ( with 2 presentations in a month) are quite stressful.

reviews.author: YT
reviews.comment_content:
There are two case studies.
The first one is an accounting case, which requires you to write an internal memo.
The second case is about management (yr2 student should have seen the case in mgmt course), requires two presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching: It really depends on your instructor. I would say my instructor is friendly and helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not bad, I think if you really invest your time for it then you will receive a good grade.
(btw i think the grading indeed quite subjective, again, depends on your instructor)
Take attendance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Online quiz on canvas, one writing assessment, two presentations.
Really have to work with your group mates together in the mgmt case presentation, it needs quite a lot of time.

reviews.author: YY_
reviews.title: kill
reviews.comment_content:
course content is fine
quite useful and impressive
remember to finish all quizzes in canvas on time (which counts 5%)
reviews.comment_teaching:
KK is a nice tutor in normal teaching
Students can usually fully understand his requirement
Class atmosphere is quite good
reviews.comment_grading:
KK is definitely a killer
I feel all my work and present is fine(his comments did not really reflect the grade, always giving positive comments)
But I got a C eventually
reviews.comment_workload:
1 written memo (which has maximum/minimum 800 words limit)
1 small presentation (20 minutes, same with the big one, but do not take account to the content, just language and presentation skills)
1 big presentation

reviews.author: Fungz
reviews.comment_content:
It teaches you some presentation skills as well as writing skills.
2 presentations plus 1 essay are assessed
This course is quite useful in terms of teaching you how to examine an essay
(1) How to avoid redundant wordings
(2) The use of synonyms.
(3) How to write a hundred paragraph with only 3 sentences. (this is weird, but my tutors love using lengthy wordings & relatives to form complex sentence structure)
reviews.comment_teaching: depends on tutor, can't say.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course grade highly depends on the instructors.
The course grade highly depends on the instructors
The course grade highly depends on the instructors.

It is very important so I say it thrice. (given that your English proficiency is not too bad.)
reviews.comment_workload: Average

reviews.author: qq
reviews.comment_content: Content is the same across all classes. Teaches you how to write in proper formal business language and make a proper presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I really love Anita. She makes the class really interesting and tries to engage everyone. The atmosphere in class was really good and I throughly enjoyed the lesson.

I have heard that there are some instructors which tell their students the exact problems that they have to discuss in their presentations/writing tasks but Anita is not the type of instructor to do that. She is very fair.
reviews.comment_grading: Heard from a few people that she was a "killer" in the first few weeks. However most people in my class ended up with A range. I guess if you put in the right amount of effort and participate a lot in class then you will end up with a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
You are supposed to finish a task each week as "homework" and bring it to class. However Anita does not really check whether or not you have done your homework, so workload is not large.

There is one writing assignment and two group presentations. You will be in the same group for the two presentations so make sure you are not working with freeriders.

Anita really cares about your presentation skills, so make sure to use a lot of EYE CONTACT and the 5Ps! Also, make sure there are no mistakes on your powerpoint slides cause SHE WILL NOTICE.

reviews.author: Kharynna
reviews.comment_content: The course heavily focuses on the development of presentation, communication, and other soft skills. Also, dives into case analyses and application of business frameworks to assist in conclusion forming.
reviews.comment_teaching: I found Delian to be very helpful and considerate with how she approaches teaching. Though she can be objective and strict with grading, she readily gives advice and cares a lot about her students. For example, on our last she brought Paisano's pizza to class to celebrate the end of the sem and the birthday of one of our classmates.
reviews.comment_grading: Strict grading but everything is covered in the syllabus. To get perfect marks, the student needs to cover not only the required portions but also exceed the teacher's expectations.
reviews.comment_workload: Average to heavy workload, depends on whether the student is comfortable with more groupwork/presentation-based grading. Lots of reading to do before class. Strict deadline and attendance guidelines. Heavily reliant on group dynamics and teamwork. Requires a lot of presentation and group projects.

reviews.author: Stanni Darwin
reviews.comment_content:
There were in total 3 cases we had to work on, and all 3 cases were really easy to understand. All cases usually focus on solving moral, social, and business-related issues so there's no need for in-depth knowledge about Finance or Operations Management or stuff like that.

Using common sense would be more than enough as long as you know how to deliver your solutions in a clear and concise way.
reviews.comment_teaching:
She's very informative and will answer all questions you have with logical explanations (although some of my classmates sometimes don't understand her points).

Her pronunciations are very clear as well and she tailors the way she explains things according to who's asking.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite harsh. I made only 1 mistake during my first presentation (which was only repeating 2 words near the end of my speech), but she didn't release the results for the 2nd presentation (I think I did pretty well since she released the recording of my group speaking and I didn't make a stuttering mistake at all) nor the recommendation report.

She did give some feedback on the report, and I got an A in the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload's not heavy at all because the case isn't even that hard to digest, but you SERIOUSLY have to practice your speech if you have difficulties in channeling clear pronunciations.

You also need to focus on the kind of delivery style Jessie recommends you to do because she'll expect you to do everything she says in class.

reviews.author: MC
reviews.title: grade depends on tutor
reviews.comment_content:
first Presentation 15%
second presentation 30%
recommendation report 40%
peer evaluation 5%
participation 10%

a group of 2 for the two presentations

the cases and the course content are different every year so there is no source

you need to memorize the script for presentation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Different tutors have different requirements and standards so follow the requirements of your tutor only is okay
her teaching style is different as she did not follow the LABU notes and has her own teaching method
for example, she did not tell you to practice rhythm and pronunciation which are required in the notes

and her class is relaxing
reviews.comment_grading:
first presentation - competent
second presentation - task (very good ), language ( competent), delivery ( competent)
report score is not released

final grade : B
reviews.comment_workload:
i think workload is ok
but you will be very stressed the night before the presentation day as you will be busy at memorizing the script

reviews.author: gradehunter
reviews.title: Good grade labu tutor
reviews.comment_content: This course is mainly about presentation and that having groupmate is the utmost important
reviews.comment_teaching: well teaching is useless, you just google everything and just read the case 10 zillion times
reviews.comment_grading:
It's very good if you are a person who is outspoken and good at presentation and making creative. Visual aids are not required but then it will leave good impression. You really have to be active in class

I actually got an A since I had good groupmates. I got high score in IELTS and DSE and I don't have to study LANG
reviews.comment_workload: It is not at all heavy, just two presentation and one essay. you really have to write it with a lot of effort since the content is actually given and what separates you apart is your organization, and of course language.

reviews.author: NL
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is quite useful since it polishes your presentation skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: The classroom atmosphere is quite good and it seems like everyone makes an effort to contribute.
reviews.comment_grading: You can definitely get a good grade if you meet all the course requirements and remember not to be late to class. It is necessary to finish every quiz on Canvas on time or else you will risk losing 5 points.
reviews.comment_workload: The presentations are quite demanding, especially for local students like me who needs to recite the script for the presentations.

reviews.author: chchanca+++vcv
reviews.title: No need to worry about grade. Grade does reflect your English proficiency
reviews.comment_content: Nothing special about business writing. The course only covers how to write formally and politely in business. It is easy to excel in the writing task with a previous solid ground of English writing. However, the later half of the course is really amazing. I really like the part of business presentation. Although content of business presentation is not the focus, it is really good the class does cover the skill to give a good business presentation. Skills about how to show confidence are discussed, eg gesture, posture, team transition and eye contact. Although these are somehow simple for a professional, they can lead you to the way to become a successful presenter on the stage. But the coverage is really not that much. Easy to pick up the skills with hard work.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ivy is really a good teacher, despite the rumor she is a killer in term of grade. In her class, she is always encouraging and praises students. She also shares how to write a business writing well. And the best of her teaching should be in business presentation. She demonstrates well about how to give a persuasive presentation taking advantage of gestures, postures and eye contact, and giving greatly constructive feedbacks to students' performance. For the purpose of improving the use of English in business environment, Ivy is the choice. By the way, as I get her resume from the Internet, I surprisingly know she was a law student in HKU before and studied about English in CityU for her master degree. No wonder she demands much for students' performance.
reviews.comment_grading:
Ivy is moderate in grading students' assignments. In my class, most of the students get satisfactorys, equivalent as a 4 in LANG1002 and 1003. But after all I think the results do reflect their English proficiency. Personally I get one competent and two very goods, which are equivalent as a 5 and 6, in the accounting internal memorandum, accounting for 35% of the total course grade, and two 5s in the first management presentation, 10% of the course grade, and two 5s and two 6s in the second presentation with a share of 40% of the course grade. I think the most important thing to get a good grade in this course is to excel in the writing task and the second presentation task. The first presentation task does not matter a lot, only a difference of a sub-grade. Finally, I get an A- from Ivy, although I don't know how the grades are distributed. Some people claim it is the instructor who makes the sole decision for grade distribution. However, some others claim instructors are responsible for giving grades in the tasks, and the total course grades would be given by the co-coordinator. I really don't know much, but I am satisfied with the A- in LABU2051.
By the way, I personally think trusting what people claim in HKGOLDEN is a great disaster. There is a famous saying from HKGOLDEN, don't get serious for people surfing at HKGOLDEN, which seems true.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is moderate in Ivy's class. One accounting internal memorandum and two management presentations to be graded. However, to complete these assignments well, a number of hours have to be spent on preparation, drafting the memorandum, sending emails to ask Ivy, meeting groupmates and rehearsing. But most importantly, it seems hard work is not always associated with good grade in Ivy's class because a good English is really the prerequisite to good feedbacks in the tasks.

reviews.author: Wilbert
reviews.title: Just a short review for an extra timetable
reviews.comment_content: The content focuses more on the cases and less on the presentation methods and what not. There are a few exercises that could help you with your presentation but most f the content learned in the course really depends on the students and not the instructor. I'd say this is a overall good course with a light atmosphere but relies more on teamwork.
reviews.comment_teaching: The atmosphere is really chill and can be really fun at times, Anita is more of a caring instructor and can give students many advice as to how to present and how analyze the case in the most appropriate format. Even though there weren't many pictures taken and jokes exchanged, I've made quite a number of friends in her class and learned quite a bit of how to work well with a team. So I'd say Anita is a good instructor with much to give.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading can be a bit stringent because of the quality she demands from the presentation and the information displayed but I'd say that in the end, the grade really represents the amount of work I put in during the course as I really tried hard for in the projects and worked well with my team.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload can either be nothing or really immense depending on the amount of effort you are willing to put into the course. For me it was 2 meetings every week for an hour and a half with a last minute lunch + rehearsal right before the last presentation so I would say that I put quite a but of work in to the course.

reviews.author: J.Li
reviews.comment_content: Anna teaches so well, I am confident to say that I have learnt a lot from the course - it's not just about the way you polish your slides, it's also about how you can make good use of the slides you've prepared and deliver what you wanna deliver to the audience.
reviews.comment_teaching: Anna is nice, she's willing to guide students on how to prepare for the presentation, she will also recommend you books to read if you are interested in the essence of powerpoint design.
reviews.comment_grading:
If she really loves you, you will receive a very decent grade from her -- FYI, I basically did mediocre in class, but because I am willing to answer her questions when there's dead silence... I have got an A grade from her.
*WARNING: the other way around - you'll be receiving a C or C- if she doesn't like you...
reviews.comment_workload: Just normal - not much to prepare every time before class, most of the work is done during class
